name: outplot
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make plans, often in secret, that are more clever or effective than those of an opponent: He has forged a reputation for outwitting and out-plotting opponents during his time in charge at the club. Our aim is to counter enemy strategy, to outplot and outmanoeuvre by any means.
More examplesFewer examplesTyrion entered a bitter power struggle with Cersei, and consistently outplotted her.The General captures Suzhou and Nanking before being out-plotted by his blood-brother warriors.
